articles.author: David Lawder, Doina Chiacu, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: "This will be the golden age of America!" Donald Trump wrote on social media. "Will there be some pain? Yes, maybe (and maybe not!)."
articles.title: Trump says Americans could feel 'pain' in trade war with Mexico, Canada, China

articles.author: Promit Mukherjee
articles.description: Canada will take legal action under the relevant international bodies to challenge the 25% tariffs imposed by the United States on most Canadian goods, a senior government official said on Sunday, calling the tariffs illegal and unjustified.
articles.title: Canada to take legal action against US for tariffs

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Elida Moreno
articles.description: U.S. top diplomat Marco Rubio warned Panama to immediately take steps to address U.S. concerns over Chinese businesses operating ports near the canal, which President Donald Trump has said represent a threat to U.S. national security.
articles.title: US official pressures Panama over Chinese businesses near the canal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of people protested in Berlin on Sunday against plans to limit immigration proposed by opposition conservatives and supported by the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD).
articles.title: Tens of thousands protest in Berlin against proposed German immigration crackdown

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: Police in Georgia arrested several anti-government protesters on Sunday as thousands of demonstrators demanding new parliamentary elections briefly blocked a motorway on the edge of the capital Tbilisi.
articles.title: Georgian opposition leader arrested as pro-EU protesters block highway

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan and China need to talk to each other to achieve peace given the "multifold changes" in the international situation, Taiwan's President Lai Ching-te said on Monday, calling for dialogue instead of confrontation.
articles.title: Taiwan and China need peace given 'multifold changes' internationally, president says

articles.author: David Shepardson, Jonathan Allen
articles.description: The Army Corps of Engineers will begin lifting the wreckage from the Potomac River on Monday. Officials have said it could take a week or longer.
articles.title: Recovery efforts in Washington helicopter-plane collision identify 55 of 67 victims

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer travels to Brussels on Monday to call on Europe to shoulder more of the burden to keep the region safe from President Vladimir Putin's Russia and redouble efforts to crush his "war machine".
articles.title: UK's Starmer in Brussels to urge unity against Russia

articles.author: Lisa Richwine, Danielle Broadway
articles.description: Beyonce won the Grammy Award for best country album on Sunday for "Cowboy Carter" at a ceremony that served as a love letter to host city Los Angeles following the devastating wildfires that scarred a hub of the music business.
articles.title: Beyonce, Sabrina Carpenter win Grammys as musicians honor Los Angeles

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday that he would cut off all future funding to South Africa because he claimed, without evidence, that "certain classes of people" were being treated "very badly."
articles.title: Trump to cut off all future funding to South Africa
